fields.description:
(Note: This should be a bug, not a suggestion, but I was unable to create this issue as "Bug" due to missing permissions.)
h3. Issue Summary

When updating a page a user is watching, but no longer allowed to view due to space permissions, a personal notification is sent to that user via Slack (assuming enabled personal notifications for updates on watched pages and blog posts).

We are using "Confluence Server for Slack (Official)" v2.0.2 in Confluence v7.3.3.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Configure Slack personal notifications for updates on pages and blog posts you are watching, i.e., only enable "When pages and posts I'm watching are updated".
 # Watch a page (w/o page restrictions) in a space you have view permissions for.
 # Now, use a different account with space administrator permissions and remove all space permissions for the respective user, i.e., the user is no longer able to view the watched page due to space permissions.
 # Now, the account remains listed as watcher for the page (cf. https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-59224). In general, I suppose this to be expected behavior (to not loose watches when first removing and later granting permissions for a space again).
 # Now, use a different account that is still allowed to view the page and update it.

A Slack notification is sent to the user watching the page although the user is no longer allowed to view it. In contrast to the Slack app, Confluence itself will NOT send an email notification in this case.

When taking a look at the Confluence source code, a check for space level permissions and content level view permissions (page restrictions) is done before sending email notifications. As this has nothing to do with content level view permissions, I suppose a wrong or missing check for space level permissions in the Slack app?
h3. Expected Results

There is NO personal notification sent via Slack.
h3. Actual Results

A personal notification is sent via Slack.
h3. Workaround

None.
fields.summary: Personal notifications are sent for pages a user is no longer allowed to view

fields.description:
Using the @user option for a Slack subscription, users can get direct messages from the Confluence app in Slack when spaces/pages have actions that trigger a notification. In the standard notification sense, this would be similar to a user selecting "Watch" on a page or space.

Confluence has a per-user setting for email notifications (toggled off by default) titled "Notify on my actions". This prevents a user's own changes from triggering an email notification to them.

Given that some users may try to use Slack subscriptions to replace email notifications, it would be helpful if the app had a similar setting. An example may be a user subscribing themselves to Slack notifications for their own personal space. The user would desire to receive notifications (via Slack) of changes from users other than themselves. Currently, they receive notifications of all changes, including their own.
fields.summary: Add "Notify on my actions" option for Slack notifications to individual users

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

The new Jira Service Desk for Slack provides agents the ability to raise tickets through Slack. However, it only allows summary and description as the fields and users cannot raise tickets if any other field is marked as required. This limits the functionality of the app.
h3. Suggested Solution

Provide the ability to raise tickets with more required fields and show a form accordingly within Slack.
h3. Workaround
 

Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available.
fields.summary: Provide ability to raise tickets with more required fields using JSD for Slack app

fields.description:
The [Jira Server for Slack (Official)|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/apps/1220099/jira-server-for-slack-official?hosting=datacenter&tab=overview] app provides integration between Jira Server and Slack. One of the features available is allowing people to receive notifications on Slack for issue creation, transition and etc.

*Suggestion*
Sometimes, these notification message templates may not suit our business needs or can be improved and we would like to customize the text.
Eg: When someone comments on a ticket, Slack users would receive the following notification
{quote}
_User_ has commented to a _IssueType_
{quote}

We would like to change to
_User_ has commented *on* a _IssueType_
fields.summary: Customization of Jira - Slack integration.

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Currently, Slack trigger notifications for Issue Created, Assignee Updated, Comments and Issue transitions. There is no option to trigger a notification when an SLA is breached/paused/completed on a project.

h3. Suggested Solution
Implement an additional option to trigger notifications for SLA events on issues.

h3. Why this is important
Some customers want to keep track of issues that have the SLAs breached/completed/paused from a project by just looking to the notification on Slack instead of checking issue.
fields.summary: Enable "SLA" events notification on Slack integration

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When using the JQL filter for a Slack notification subscription, the autocomplete matcher is not properly filtering usernames. Regardless of the name typed, the same set of users is shown in the dropdown list.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a new subscription or modify an existing subscription
 # Switch to JQL filtering
 # Add a username field to the filter - examples:
{code:java}
reporter ={code}
or
{code:java}
assignee ={code}
 # Observe that the dropdown returns alphabetical results (A -> Z) of all users
 # Start typing a username

h3. Expected Results

Dropdown starts filtering to show only matches from the partially-typed user name
h3. Actual Results

Dropdown results are not filtered
h3. Workaround
 # Create a regular *issue search* in Jira
 # Use the autocomplete filter to select the user you wish to add to the Slack JQL filter
 # Copy the user's ID from the regular issue search - example: 
{code:java}assignee = 7b026df108a7a0020d7dcab9{code}
 # Paste the user's ID into the Slack JQL filter
fields.summary: JQL filter does not autocomplete usernames correctly

fields.description:
When [integrating Jira Cloud and Slack|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirasoftwarecloud/jira-cloud-for-slack-950819054.html], the following command helps in order to create an issue and have the issue type automatically populated in the process:

/jira create issueType Summary description

The command works well when the issue type has a single word (automatically putting it in the dropdown for the type), but, if it has more than one word (e.g. Service Request), it will not populate properly. Instead, it will show a different type in the dropdown, as demonstrated in the video below (from a test instance), comparing the creation between different issue types:

 [^slack.mp4] 

h4.Suggestion

This is a suggestion to allow the integration with Slack to allow issue types with more than one word to be inserted from the command. As a workaround, the user can select the type from the dropdown displayed in the issue's creation.
fields.summary: Allow issue types with more than one word to be created from Slack

h3. Issue Summary

It's possible to run different pipelines on the same branch. Current Slack notification contains just the branch on which pipeline was run, but misses its name. So it's not clear which pipelines causes Slack notification.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Run 2 pipelines with different names on the same branch.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Notifications in Slack is not rendered as per Jira's text formatting 

h3. Environment
* Jira Server
* Slack
* [Jira Server for Slack (Official)|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/apps/1220099/jira-server-for-slack-official?hosting=server&tab=overview] app

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Configure Jira to Slack as per [this guide|https://confluence.atlassian.com/slack/using-jira-applications-with-slack-966662163.html]
# Check the option to send a message to the channel when 'Someone leaves a comment' 
# Add a new comment and observe the message in Slack
# Add another comment that uses multiple text formatting in Jira
# Observe the message in Slack

h3. Expected Results
Text formatting is preserved in the Slack message

h3. Actual Results
Not all text formatting is preserved in the Slack message. As a result, message may be difficult to read in Slack.

 !jira-slack.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Notes
Text formatting for Slack can be found in [this link|https://get.slack.help/hc/en-us/articles/202288908-Format-your-messages]

h3. Workaround
Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Inconsistent text formatting of Slack notifications for Jira

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Atlassian Cloud app in Gmail does not render custom imported project images

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Integrate Jira with Gmail using the Atlassian Cloud app
# Update a project with a custom image that is not one of the suggestions from Jira but use your own image
# The app does not render the project image

h3. Expected Results
The app should display the image of the project as expected

h3. Actual Results
It displays the broken icon for the project image.

h3. Workaround
 Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Atlassian Cloud app in Gmail does not render custom imported project images

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When a user adds a comment in a Confluence page, the resulting notification in Slack refer as though the creator of the page has made a comment instead of the actual user who made the comment.
h5. Version

The issue was tested in version 2.0.2
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Login to Confluence, lets say this user has the username user1.
 # Create or take not of an existing Space.
 # Create a page in the above space.
 # Connect Confluence with Slack.
 # Setup Confluence to receive notification from a the above space.
 # Click on the *User Avatar* > *Settings* > *Slack Notification*
 # Ensure to set *When pages and posts I created get new comments* to true.
 # Ensure that you have connected your user with a Slack account via *Slack Accounts* option.
 # With the above set, you should get notifications when another user comments on a page you have created.
 # Log out.
 # Login using a different user (lets call them user2), and add a comment to the page that was created by user1.

h3. Expected Results

In Slack the notificat should read.
{code:java}
 user2 commented on page_name in SpaceName
 > Lorem Ipsum{code}
h3. Actual Results

In Slack the notification reads:
{code:java}
 user1 commented on page_name in SpaceName
 > Lorem Ipsum{code}
h3. Note

The issue occurs in Pages as well as in blogs.
h3. Workaround

No known workaround
fields.summary: When a user adds a comment in a page, the resulting Slack notification does not correctly refer to the comment creator.

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
The Jira Cloud for Slack app does not allow for approvers to approve a Jira Service Desk request directly from Slack. The option to have approval workflows that go directly into Slack with quick actions will help these workflows move faster.

h3. Suggested Solution
Add the option to approve or decline a Jira Service Desk request that needs approval directly from Slack via an integration.

h3. Workaround
Set up a notification in Jira Cloud for Slack when the request is transitioned to the approval status. The approvers can be notified in Slack but they will have to click the request to open Jira Service Desk where the request can be approved or declined.
fields.summary: Add approval workflow to Slack integration

fields.description:
As a Jira admin, it would be nice to have the ability to disable the *"Dedicated Channel"* feature.

h4. Actual Behavior
When you link a Jira ticket to a Slack channel, it automatically sets the topic of the channel and you have to manually clear it to remove it
Since there's no limitation to the number of issues linked to a channel and the change to the topic happens at the moment one creates the link, it became an annoying behavior.

h4. Suggestion
It would be nice to have the ability to disable the *"Dedicated Channel"* feature.
fields.summary: Jira for Slack integration: Ability to disable "dedicated channel" feature

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Enabling enhanced message verbosity in the Slack configuration causes duplicate messages to be sent.

This includes using 'dedicated channel' and 'project' configurations, as dedicated channel appears to default to enhanced.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Configure dedicated channel or project link with enhanced verbosity.
 # Observe duplicate messages sent to channel(s).

h3. Expected Results

Single message is sent to Slack channel.
h3. Actual Results

Multiple message are sent to Slack Channel.
h3. Workaround

Using Basic verbosity and/or do not use dedicated channel links.
fields.summary: Enabling enhanced message verbosity in the Slack configuration causes duplicate messages to be sent.

fields.description: At this time Slack has a hard-coded limit of 2500 characters even though we select the extended version of the notification. It would be nice if we had the option to select the number of characters which should be displayed.
fields.summary: Add the ability to configure the number of characters in Slack

fields.description:
As a user, I would like to be notified in Slack when tickets that are associated with *me* (watching, assigned, reporter, etc. as options) have been modified.

 

Examples from other tickets:
 * _However we would like to ask whether it is possible to list the Jira issues that are currently assigned to you (for example all issues that are assigned to you and are in status In Progress) from SLACK?_
fields.summary: Personal Jira Notifications in Slack

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

The Atlassian Gmail add-on supports both Jira and bitbucket, however it is not possible to use it without logging in to Jira for users using Bitbucket only - which shouldn't be necessary
h3. Steps to Reproduce

N/A
h3. Expected Results

N/A
h3. Actual Results
{noformat}
N/A
{noformat}
h3. Workaround

Required, if there is no workaround please state:
 Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Using the Atlassian Gmail add-on without a Jira account

fields.description: The add-in currently only supports the ability to refresh on a manual basis. Users want their imported Jira issues updated on a periodic basis, rather than only on demand.
fields.summary: Schedule refresh of Jira issues on Jira Cloud for Excel Integration

fields.description:
h3.Summary

As per the summary, the issue details returned by JIRA Cloud for Sheets should be enclosed in within a data table. This will make it easier for users to work with the returned data. 

With this feature, it will also be preferable to be able to directly update the data table contents by right clicking it and selecting 'update'.
fields.summary: JIRA Cloud for Sheets issue details should be enclosedby a data table in Excel

fields.description:
h3. Summary

There are issue cards on the first screen where the user can see the assignee, status, and priority. The user can click on that card to see more details and edit some fields (assignee, priority, status, etc). After editing those fields user returns to the issue cards view and will see that those fields are not updated.
h3. Environment

Jira Cloud for Outlook
h3. Steps to reproduce
 # Install the integration and check the assignee in the issue card.
 # Click on the card, edit the assignee.
 # Close the card and see that the assignee field wasn't updated.

h3. Expected results

It shows the current assignee.
h3. Actual result

The card is not updated with the current assignee.
h3. Workaround

This doesn’t affect assigning functionality though, it still works. Reloading issue cards view resolves the issue.
fields.summary: Issue cards are not updated after editing assignee, priority or status fields

fields.description: In many cases it's useful to have all repositories in a single project integrate to a Slack channel. Rather than having to configure all the repositories individually, it would be beneficial to be able to configure the Project to send notifications.
fields.summary: Allow integration to Slack at the project level

fields.description:
The message style for issue mentions or _/jira ABC-123_ uses the Default message style.

Channel notifications can be configured between _default_ and _extended_, which includes the issue description.

!image-2019-11-21-10-59-28-893.png|width=508,height=222!

 

It would be helpful if the */jira unfurl* command had an option to toggle unfurl messages between the default and extended styles.
fields.summary: Configure issue mention unfurl style

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Currently, Deep Linking with Slack requires the usage of the protocol that goes by slack://. As of today, Confluence does not support the use of custom protocols. See: https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-24665

With this situation in mind, we believe that creating a direct integration between Confluence and Slack, for linking, should helps customers to overcome this.
h3. Workaround
 Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Integrate Slack Deep Linking (slack://) with Confluence

Delete the data manually...

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When a customer deletes a branch using the command line, a notification is sent to Slack even when the "Repository -> Branch deleted" setting is not enabled.

This only occurs when the "Commits -> Pushed" setting is enabled.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Enable the "Commits -> Pushed" setting and make sure that the "Repository -> Branch deleted" one is disabled
 # Perform the following steps to create and delete a branch:
{noformat}
git checkout -b slack_notification_branch
git push origin slack_notification_branch
git branch -d slack_notification_branch
git push origin :slack_notification_branch
{noformat}

h3. Expected Results
No notification is sent to Slack on the branch deletion.

h3. Actual Results
The following notification is received in Slack:
{noformat}
Caterina Curti deleted branch slack_notification_branch in <project>/<repository>
{noformat}


h3. Workaround
Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available

*Notes*
No notification is sent if the "Commits -> Pushed" setting is not enabled.
fields.summary: With the "Branch deleted" setting not enabled, deleting a branch via the command line send a notification to Slack

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Jira Server Slack integration allows user to create dedicated channels for an issue - see [How can I create a dedicated channel for an issue?|https://confluence.atlassian.com/slack/using-jira-applications-with-slack-966662163.html#UsingJiraapplicationswithSlack-HowcanIcreateadedicatedchannelforanissue?]. This channel will now post all notifications, included restricted comments which are not meant for all users in the channel. 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a dedicated channel in Slack
# Add a restricted comment in the issue

h3. Expected Results
Restricted / internal comments are not posted to Slack

h3. Actual Results
All comments are posted to Slack

h3. Workaround
Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Slack dedicated channel posts notifications for restricted comments

fields.description:
h3. Problem

When connecting Jira and any CRM software using the Jira Cloud for CRM add-on, the customer information will start showing in the integration panel, but it's not possible to use that information in JQL filters/SLA goals.

h3. Suggested resolution

Have the ability to use the CRM fields in JQL filters.
fields.summary: Ability to use Jira Cloud for CRM fields in JQL filters/SLA goals

fields.description:
h3. Problem

When commenting from Slack to Jira, it appends to the comment the following "This comment was left via Slack". It sounds unprofessional per the customer point of view, and also gives information about the tools used internally.

h3. Suggested resolution

Ability to remove the "This comment was left via Slack" from comments made via Slack.
fields.summary: Ability to remove the "This comment was left via Slack" from the comments

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

As per title, multi-line string values extracted by Jira Cloud for CRM is ignoring line breaks. This caused the text to appear clumped together in one line.

h3. Steps to Reproduce

Just attempt extracting values from a multi line text field like the description field.

h3. Expected Results

Text retain the multi line formatting.

h3. Actual Results

Text appears in one line; ignoring line breaks.

h3. Workaround

 Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Multi-line string values extracted by Jira Cloud for CRM is ignoring line breaks

fields.description:
Could this Currently when there is an event triggered in a Jira application that is linked to Slack using the Atlassian Jira for Slack connector, the event will appear on Slack like this: "Agent commented to a Story"
 !image-2019-10-25-16-54-15-617.png|thumbnail! 

While on the Bitbucket case, you get "Agent commented *on* a pull request":
 !image-2019-10-25-16-59-27-495.png|thumbnail! 

The request is to have them both using the same working.
fields.summary: In Slack: change the wording of the events to be homologated across Atlassian applications

fields.description:
There is already an "Add Slack message to Pull request" action.

I want to have the similar action for issues - "Add Slack message to issue".
fields.summary: Add Slack message to issue

fields.description:
Add personal notifications (new comment, new commit, any update). For instance:
 * Events in my PR
 * Events in PR I am watching
 * Events in PR I am reviewing
 * Comment on my commit
 * Notifications on my Pipelines build
fields.summary: Personal notifications

fields.description:
If a Bitbucket Server instance is not publicly exposed, but it is able to connect to the internet and hit Slack, the connection shows as "Limited" and the configuration process is unable to proceed as Slack cannot reach back out to Bitbucket.

Instead of being stuck in an incomplete state, it would be great if the plugin allowed you to use the plugin in its limited state - and allow for only operations that need Bitbucket to talk to Slack, such as pulling channel data into Bitbucket and sending notification payloads back to Slack like a webhook. 

This may require a different authentication method other than OAuth as a result, but this would help reduce the inconvenience of needing to install an entirely separate Slack integration plugin if an organization cannot publicly expose their instance to Slack.
fields.summary: Allow configuration of only one-way communication from Bitbucket Server to Slack

fields.description:
*Add-on Atlassian Cloud for Gmail does not allow to change the status.*

- Would be nice to be able to change the status using the app.
fields.summary: Allow to change status via Add-on Atlassian Cloud for Gmail

fields.description:
h4. Summary
Not currently possible to add comments on Confluence via Slack conversations

h4. Suggested Solution
Add an integration so that when a user adds a new reply to a Slack conversation, a comment is added to the specified page in Confluence
fields.summary: Ability to add comment to a page in Confluence via Slack conversation

fields.description:
I really like the feature of hyperlinking automatically when an issue key is mentioned in the body of an email. However I think it would be more useful if the pop up box included the description and comments on the issue similar to the Show Issues tab in Outlook. Having all that information in one click when an issue is mentioned in an email would be very convenient. A stretch goal would be having the ability to comment and @mention in the pop up box as well.

Steps to reproduce:
 # Include issue key in the body of an email
 # Click on the issue key and a pop up box should appear
fields.summary: Show more information in pop up box when issue key is mentioned in email body

fields.description:
Currently, Jira Cloud for Outlook doesn't fully support shared mailboxes. In some cases, attachments are not uploaded or the add-in is not available at all.

If the add-in is available, it's confusing that the "Include X attachments" is visible because it won't work.
fields.summary: Support shared mailboxes

fields.description:
People are always asking questions in Slack that either should have been tickets in the first place, or turn into requests that should be managed in Jira. It's a priority for some of our teams to be able to create issues from Slack, they don't care about getting Jira notifications in their channels.

 

Aware of the (fairly pricey) add-on options, but given this is available for Cloud for free it makes them feel even more pricey.

Question - is this just not possible at all or could we possibly hack a slack command if we follow the instructions to create a custom app instead of installing the packaged one from the marketplace?
fields.summary: Create issue from Slack in Jira Server/DC

fields.description:
h3. Problem

Sometimes agents only want to have customer comments being posted on the Slack channels and not their own comments being posted as well. It causes duplicate information under their channels.

h3. Suggested resolution

Provide a way to differentiate customer comments from agent comments and only post customer comments on Slack.
fields.summary: Differentiate agent comments from customer comments and add a filter to only post customer comments

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Currently, Slack trigger notifications for Issue Created, Assignee Updated, Comments and Issue transitions. There is no option to trigger a notification when an issue is moved from a project to another.

h3. Suggested Solution
Implement an additional option to trigger notifications for moved issues.

h3. Why this is important
Some customers want to keep track of issues that are being moved from one project to another by just looking to the notification on Slack instead of checking issue history.

h3. Workaround 
NA
fields.summary: Enable "issue moved" notification on slack

fields.description:
h3. Definition

It would be very convenient if the users can approve/reject or transition issues through Slack channel. This feature is already available in Slack for Jira Cloud.

h3. Suggestion
Add the same feature in Slack for Jira server.
fields.summary: Add support for transitioning issues through Slack

fields.description:
With our recent updates to unfurling, we require that users authenticate themselves with Atlassian, so that we know who they are and can guarantee they have access to the issue they are trying to unfurl. 

Unfortunately, Slack Guest Users are unable to authenticate themselves because we require that the user authenticates with Slack, something guest users in Slack are incapable of doing. 

It is possible for us to just authenticate the Guest User on the Atlassian side, although they won't be able to take any actions (via the "..." menu) or use slash commands to create Jira issues, as we won't be able to authenticate them on the Slack side.

This feature request is to support guest users to be able to unfurl via a secondary authentication method that does not exist and needs to be built
fields.summary: Slack Guest User support for Unfurling

fields.description: [For the reference|https://community.atlassian.com/t5/Jira-articles/Try-Jira-Cloud-for-Outlook-Organize-your-work-without-leaving/bc-p/1188151#M1574].
fields.summary: List issue in a task pane if issue key is mentioned in an email subject

fields.description:
With the Jira for Outlook app when adding a comment in Show Issues in Outlook, it does not have the ability to @mention a user. This is possible in the plugin as it works for assigning users to issues. Can the user picker functionality be extended to comments as well? Most comments in my team involve tagging users.

Steps to reproduce:
 # Open an email in Outlook containing an excerpt of a Jira Issue
 # Select Show Issues in the Jira Cloud ribbon in Outlook
 # Select the issue in the View Issues tab in the pane
 # Try adding a comment and @mentioning a user
 # Check the comment in Jira and the @mention will be in plain text without the user tagged.
fields.summary: Jira for Outlook mention users in comments

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

In the current [Bitbucket Server for Slack|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/apps/1220729/bitbucket-server-for-slack-official?hosting=server&tab=overview] integration, each repository can be configured to send notifications to only one Slack channel.

It would be great if there was a way to direct notifications for a repository to different channels based on some rules (e.g. regex pattern).
 The sample use case for this would be to have notifications for different branches in the repo to be sent to different channels.
h3. Possible Solution

The third-party plugin [Slack notifications plugin|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/apps/1213042/slack-notifications-plugin?hosting=server&tab=overviewa] provides a way to direct notifications to different channels using regex patterns.
 e.g.
 !regex_pattern_sample.png!

 
-
fields.summary: Bitbucket Server for Slack Suggestion: Send notifications to different channels based on pattern

fields.description: Currently, only public comments are available.
fields.summary: Allow commenting internally/externally (JSD)

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
At this moment, any user on Slack (with admin access or not) can create a subscription to a project trough Slack on Jira. 


h3. Suggested Solution
It would be useful if only users with administrative privileges in the project (project lead, Jira-administrator, administrator, site-admin) could create this subscription for notifications on Slack trough Slack.

h3. Why this is important
Some projects might have sensitive data or privileged information that only certain users can see. If any user can create a Subscription for project updates in Slack, this information will be visible for users that shouldn't have access to it.
fields.summary: Administrator permission on the project to create the subscription through Slack

fields.description:
h4. Summary
There's currently no ability to update tasks (action items) in Confluence via a Slack conversation.

h4. Suggested Solution
Link a task to a Slack thread, allowing users to update action items with notes/messages, and share information with the assignee regarding that task (without having to update the task or page directly)
fields.summary: Ability to update tasks through Slack

fields.description:
It would be super useful to be able to create a task and specify which project and assignee it is, all within one message command.

That way, we can use macros/hotkeys to add tasks within the desired project and the appropriate assignee within two key presses, leaving just the task summary to be typed
fields.summary: Add [assignee] and [project] fields to the /jira create command

fields.description:
Currently the {{JIRA()}} function within Google Sheets does not support the Super-Epic issue type within Jira.

I would like to be able to import a Story or an Epic using the {{JIRA()}} function and show the Super-Epic to which it belongs (similar to using the 'epic link' column within the function).

e.g.

{{=JIRA("project = <PROJECT>' order by issuekey", "issuekey,issuetype,summary,status,super-epic link,epic link")}}
fields.summary: Add support for Super-Epics

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Get the Jira Cloud bot via the Jira-Slack integration to mention and list the Jira key issue as a threaded comment in Slack instead of its own post in the channel.

h3. Suggested Solution
Add this as a threaded comment in Slack room


h3. Why this is important
To reduce the number of messages in the channel directly by focussing it on a thread
fields.summary: Get the Jira Cloud bot via the Jira-Slack integration to mention and list the Jira key issue as a threaded comment

fields.description: The message that comes in Slack contains only the event for the action and the link for what is happening, but it would be good to be able to set a custom message for each event.
fields.summary: Allow customizing the message in Slack

fields.description: Currently the add-on will add a hyperlink only to issue keys during the import from sidebar JQL/Filter. Which means if my query has fields like, "Epic Link", "Linked Issues", they will not get a hyperlink. As a user I would prefer to have ALL fields which point to an issue to have hyperlink support.
fields.summary: Hyperlink support for all issue type fields

fields.description: Currently the issue keys get a hyperlink only if the data is imported in Google sheets using the sidebar JQL/Filter import. As a user I would prefer if the issue keys get a hyperlink for imports done through =JIRA() formula/custom function as well.
fields.summary: Linkify issue keys from =JIRA() custom function

fields.description: The Slack integration in Jira does not display the user who set up a particular notification subscription. Also, as the Slack integration has recently made a change where the subscription to private channel is shown as #unknown if the user is not part of the channel. This could be important to figure the owner of the subscription and the relevant channel.
fields.summary: Display the user who has set-up the Slack notification subscription in Jira Cloud

fields.description:
h3. Current behavior
At the moment, it isn't possible to be able to edit pages within Slack without having to navigate to the page in Confluence. 

h3. Expected behavior
It would be great to be able to edit Confluence pages without leaving the Slack application.
fields.summary: Add the ability to edit pages through Slack
Option to integrate all Slack accounts with Confluence
